meanings.definition: Not subject to corruption or decay.
meanings.sent1: The ancient artifact remained incorrupt despite being buried for centuries.
meanings.sent2: The fresh fruit was incorrupt and free from any signs of spoilage.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's suit was so incorrupt that even acid couldn't damage it.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was as pure and incorrupt as a crystal clear stream.
meanings.sent5: The incorrupt diamond sparkled brilliantly in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: Free from moral corruption or dishonesty.
meanings.sent1: The honest judge was known for his fair and incorrupt decisions.
meanings.sent2: She was an incorrupt leader who always put the needs of her people first.
meanings.sent3: The incorrupt detective always solved the case with integrity and honor.
meanings.sent4: His incorrupt character shone brightly in a world full of deceit.
meanings.sent5: The community trusted her because of her impeccable and incorrupt reputation.
